entry.name: delegate
entry.title: .delegate()
entry.desc: Attach a handler to one or more events for all elements that match the selector, now or in the future, based on a specific set of root elements.

argument.name: selector
argument.desc: A selector to filter the elements that trigger the event.

argument.name: eventType
argument.desc: A string containing one or more space-separated JavaScript event types, such as "click" or "keydown," or custom event names.

argument.name: handler(eventObject)
argument.desc: A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

argument.name: selector
argument.desc: A selector to filter the elements that trigger the event.

argument.name: eventType
argument.desc: A string containing one or more space-separated JavaScript event types, such as "click" or "keydown," or custom event names.

argument.name: eventData
argument.desc: An object containing data that will be passed to the event handler.

argument.name: handler(eventObject)
argument.desc: A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

argument.name: selector
argument.desc: A selector to filter the elements that trigger the event.

argument.name: events
argument.desc: A plain object of one or more event types and functions to execute for them.

longdesc.p: As of jQuery 1.7, .delegate() has been superseded by the .on() method. For earlier versions, however, it remains the most effective means to use event delegation.
